Игра для релакса. Минимум токсичности. По большей части игры проходят весело. Легко и интересно играть как с друзьями, так и самому. Иногда попадается тупая школота или русня, которые токсичат после игры. Но таких мало и в любой момент можно просто выключить чат)). А так, вот мой совет - воспринимайте игру как способ расслабиться после тяжелого дня. Не стоит нервничать по пустякам в игре. Это все шутки))

TL;DR Do not play public, stick with customized matches with friends, and watching videos/streams. You'll save yourself alot of mental health if you do.

After all my time playing, and even longer time watching Dead by Daylight related videos/streams, I would not recommend playing this game. At least not with the public matches.

As cool as the characters are, especially the iconic ones like Micheal Myers, Pyramid Head, and Pinhead. The gameplay loop is very boring and/or frustrating. With either survivors holding down left click as their main objective, killers having powers that get stale after a decent amount of playtime.
 
And not to mention the uncountable number of game breaking bugs (some are years old), horrendous grind with separate levels of perks, lots of content being locked by paywalls, grindwalls, and rng shrines, and the long 6 month wait time for game balance patches, preferring to do weak bandaid fixes over actual patching that you might see from other games. 

There is also issues with accessibility, only taking backlash from their playerbase just for them to add Color Blind settings. And yet, there still exists problems with no FOV sliders, epilepsy with strobe lights created from survivors flashlights, and no volume slider for loud music.

For those of you still wanting to play this, I would recommend only playing custom games with your friends. Otherwise, don't play in public matches.

Es bastante dificil recomendar un juego lleno de bugs, cheats y gente random que te va a hacer renegar como nunca. Pero si logras sortear, ignorar o lidiar con estos problemas, el juego es super divertido. Mi recomendacion es que se juegue siempre acompañado con amigos, ya que de esa manera es cuando mas divertido se vuelve. Despues cabe resaltar que tiene una curva de aprendizaje bastante larga (o al menos en mi caso). Yo que ya tengo 1000hs del juego y recien estoy empezando a jugar de forma mas suelta y es cuando mas se disfruta. Asi que si te sientes frustrado a las 100hs de haberlo jugado, lo que te puedo decir es que te falta jugarlo mas, solo eso.

The best game to play with friends! Ameeeega

Great game with simple mechanics. Easy to get into, yet leaves room to adapt strategy and techniques. Plenty of killers and survivors to choose from with more on the way. And the fact that it is cross platform makes it easy to play with friends. HOWEVER! there is a VERY important caveat, this is only if you look over a specific list of outliers that are almost too common. including but not limited to; hackers, bots, manipulated game mechanics, and toxic players. And the Dev's are targeting popular perks for Nerf's because too many are using such perks (even though many hours may have been put in to get such perks on favorite survivors.).

Firstly I just want to say, my POV comes from a survivor player! I do not play killer! 

I would recommend this game if you have three or four friends who you really want to spend more time on voice chat with. Frustrating situations with other players can be laughed off, and working as a team can be really rewarding. It is super fun to save each other and escape together. Cosmetics are very hit and miss, and almost always cost real life money, but hey, at least you can have bunny ears with awesome physics. 

If you are survivor on your own, this game can be really challenging and frustrating. Other players on your team are unreliable, the learning curve is pretty steep, and game matching by skill is very, very poor. Endgame chats can be quite toxic at times, and don't even bother delving into the community if you aren't ready for a whole slab of negativity.

For me, it has brought me closer to three amazing friends. Which is amazing! But, we all mutually agree that we would have nowhere near as many hours on it if we weren't playing together.
Extremely fun to play with friends. Highly recommend.
morally i should not recommend this game to other players but fine

Incompetent developers, and literally one of the worst communities I have ever had the displeasure of interacting with. Can't recommend this game to people who haven't played it for a while, it's incredibly difficult to learn survivor or killer without getting berated. I've been playing since 2016, with over 1,600 hours on Xbox, and it still feels just as garbage now in 2022.
This game is infuriating and runs like doodoo

Edit: Previously complained about matchmaking which was absolutely fucking unbearable at the original time of review, only a month ago. It has improved somewhat since then, with supposedly more work to be done to improve soon. We'll see if it's actually improved enough for me to take that back completely.

But fuck BHVR for doing NFTs.

Great game to pass up some time, however there are moments when the community can be very toxic. Nevertheless a fun game to play with your friends.

Brutally Honest: Repetitive, few of  the players base are toxic but the rest of the community are actually respectful and actually enjoy the game, New updates always screw up the game, fun with friends, NFT, stereotypical 4 survivors vs 1 killer game, Has a lot of famous killers from almost all horror movies slashers. a lot of customization and very rewarding but the grind is going to tire you out pretty quick. Micro transactions? Yes for cosmetics skins and clothes, graphics are pretty decent but I think they could remodel the characters and improve them. A lot of different maps location, including movie and game locations too.

Who I main 247: Michael Myers, Jake Park and Laurie Strode. Ps. I do a lot of Jump scares.

Halloween: I give out free BP or decide to kill.
